p: Finally, based on the results of ANOVA and Duncanâ€™s tests, occupation of the informants had a significant effect on their traditional medicinal knowledge ( F = 4.19, p = 0.01), and genuine information belonged to the herbal healers, nomadic people, and villagers, respectively. Field surveys revealed that herbal healers, due to their job requirement, record and learn the relevant knowledge of the other ethnic groups like nomadic and villagers and usually have more comprehensive traditional knowledge.
